meanings.definition: In a manner resembling an ape.
meanings.sent1: She climbed the tree apishly, just like a curious monkey.
meanings.sent2: The children at the zoo watched the apishly swinging primates with fascination.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mimic the ape's walk apishly, causing laughter among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved apishly across the stage, embodying the grace of a chimpanzee.
meanings.sent5: The actor's portrayal of the ape was so apishly realistic that it earned him an award.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a foolish or clumsy manner.
meanings.sent1: Her apishly awkward attempts at juggling made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent2: The apishly dressed man tripped over his own feet in the crowded street.
meanings.sent3: The chef's apishly large hat kept falling into the soup, much to the amusement of the diners.
meanings.sent4: The apishly painted clown face brought smiles to the faces of the children at the party.
meanings.sent5: His apishly exaggerated gestures during the play added a comedic touch to the performance.
